title: Everything to know about the Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek doping cases
description: Last year, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek each tested positive for a banned substance. Here's where each doping case stands.Ôªø

title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest of 2025
description: Madison Keys won her first Grand Slam and Jannik Sinner defended his Australian Open title. What does this mean for the rest of the year? We take a look.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Raducanu to play Indian Wells after stalking ordeal
description: Britain's Emma Raducanu will travel to the WTA tournament in Indian Wells after deciding to play following her recent stalking ordeal.

title: Sinner's Laureus award nomination withdrawn after ban
description: Jannik Sinner's nomination for the Laureus World Sportsman of the Year award is withdrawn after he was given a three-month doping ban.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Shared coach, but only one winner! Baez tops Comesana in Santiago
description: Argentine Sebastian Baez began his Movistar Chile Open title defence Thursday by ousting countryman Francisco Comesana, with whom he shares a coach, Sebastian Gutierrez. Fresh off successfully defending his Rio de Janeiro title, Baez is aiming to match that feat in Santiago, where he survived Comesana 6-3, 5-7, 7-6(5) to reach the quarter-finals.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always very hard to play with Fran. He‚Äôs a great guy, we share our team, so we are together so much,‚Äù Baez said during his on-court interview. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always difficult, but I‚Äôm happy to be in the next round.‚ÄùRed-hot Sebastian üå∂Ô∏èThe defending champ @sebaabaez7 extends his winning streak, taking down compatriot Comesa√±a in a great encounter! üá¶üá∑@chile_open | #MovistarChileOpen pic.twitter.com/bbVbQrUTlk‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) February 27, 2025 Baez trailed 3/5 in the deciding-set tie-break before tallying four consecutive points and sealing the victory with a rainbow lob winner. Leading 2/1 in the tie-break, the 24-year-old Baez retrieved a drop shot from Comesana and tumbled, looking up in disbelief after realising that he struck a winner. A seven-time tour-level champion, Baez is on a six-match winning streak. He has captured a Tour-leading 74 clay-court wins since the start of the 2022 season, according to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index. Up next for the No. 31 player in the PIF ATP Rankings will be Damir Dzumhur, who overcame sixth seed Mariano Navone 6-4, 3-6, 6-3 after two hours, 36 minutes. The 32-year-old saved seven of the 10 points he faced, according to Infosys ATP Stats. It will be Baez and Dzumhur's first Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Dubai tennis schedule?
description: The two semi-final clashes of the 2025 Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships will be played on Friday with two-time finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas and Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime among the stars in action on centre court.¬† The fourth-seeded Tsitsipas will take on Tallon Griekspoor, who saved four match points en route to defeating top seed Daniil Medvedev on Thursday. The first night-session match scheduled is Auger-Aliassime's contest against French qualifier Quentin Halys. View the full Dubai Friday order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 28 FEBRUARY 2025 Centre Court - start 1:00 PM [Q] Robin Haase (NED) / Hendrik Jebens (GER) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR) Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Alexei Popyrin (AUS) vs Jamie Murray (GBR) / John Peers (AUS) Not Before 5:00 PM [Q] Quentin Halys (FRA) vs Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN) Not Before 7:00 PM Tallon Griekspoor (NED) vs [4] Stefanos Tsitsipas (GRE) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Sinner Dominates in One Sided Australian Open Final
description: Jannik Sinner successfully defended his Australian Open title on Sunday, landing his third Grand Slam commandingly with a 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 victory over Alexander Zverev. Sinner was ruthless from the baseline and did not face a single break point throughout the two-hour, 42-minute final. The Italian showed his extra firepower from the outset, which has ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Australian Open 2025 Day 13 Semi Final Recap
description: Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev will face off in Sunday‚Äôs 2025 Australian Open final after winning their semi-finals on Friday. Alexander Zverev was the first to move into Sunday‚Äôs showpiece, defeating Novak Djokovic when the Serb retired after losing the first set on a tiebreak. Novak had not hit a tennis ball since his win ‚Ä¶
